title: Deepika Padukone Believes In The 'Power Of Cinema' & Says We Need More Of It!
text:
Deepika Padukone Believes In The 'Power Of Cinema' & Says We Need More Of It!

Deepika Padukone Believes In The 'Power Of Cinema' & Says We Need More Of It!

Whenever we feel a bit lonely or low, we watch a good film and that instantly makes us feel better.

Deepika Padukone feels the same. The actress who has been vocal about depression spoke about the impact of cinema on our lives, at MAMI Film Festival.

Twitter

Deepika who graced the event of MAMI last night said in an interaction that cinema has the power to makes us feel less lonely and we agree with her.

She said, “Cinema has the power to make us less lonely when we are. In the age of digital streaming and social media that is slowly but surely is isolating us, the Mumbai Academy of Moving Images (MAMI) binds us without boundaries, inhibitions and most importantly without fear. As an artist who truly believes in the power of cinema, I say we need this more than ever before.”

Talking about being a chairperson at MAMI she said, “Many of you are probably wondering why I am here and that the role of a Chairperson is for someone older and wiser. Many others believe that I am too young, too mainstream, too tall and now look what I am wearing! (referring to her gown). But I am here for two reasons, to learn and to give back to the community, which has given me so much.”

Twitter

The film festival will launch on October 24, 2019. Deepika will be seen next in Chhapaak and 83.
